title: How to Connect Airpods Without a Case

steps.title: AirPods can only enter Pairing Mode if they are inside the case.
steps.content: AirPods can only enter Pairing Mode if they are inside the case. If you want to pair them to a device you've never used them with, you'll need the case. [1] X Research source But if you've already paired your AirPods with a device like your iPhone , Android, or laptop, you won't need the case to reconnect and listen to audio. Learn what fellow readers suggest at the "Frustrated. Why won't my Airpods connect to my MacBook?" wikiHow forum post.

steps.title: Open Control Center.
steps.content: Open Control Center . To do this, swipe down from the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap and hold the audio card.
steps.content: Tap and hold the audio card. It's the card in the top right corner that shows your current media.

steps.title: Tap the AirPlay icon.
steps.content: Tap the AirPlay icon. This icon looks like a triangle inside circles in the top right corner of the audio card. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap to select your AirPods from the list of paired Bluetooth devices.
steps.content: Tap to select your AirPods from the list of paired Bluetooth devices. If you've previously paired your AirPods, you'll see them show up here as long as they are on and within range. [3] X Research source If your AirPods do not show up here, you'll need the case to perform troubleshooting issues, like re-pairing.

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings.
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings. You can swipe down from the top of the screen to access Quick Panel and tap the gear icon. Or you can tap the app icon that looks like a gear. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Bluetooth.
steps.content: Tap Bluetooth . You'll see this next to the Bluetooth icon. [5] X Research source You should see a list of paired devices that you can connect to.

steps.title: Tap to select your AirPods.
steps.content: Tap to select your AirPods. If you've previously paired your AirPods, you'll see them show up here as long as they are on and within range. [6] X Research source If your AirPods do not show up here, you'll need the case to perform troubleshooting issues, like forgetting the connection and pairing again.

steps.title: Click the Bluetooth icon in the menu tray.
steps.content: Click the Bluetooth icon in the menu tray. If you don't see the Bluetooth icon, go to System Preferences > Bluetooth .

steps.title: Click to select your AirPods and click Connect.
steps.content: Click to select your AirPods and click Connect . The AirPods will connect to your Mac. [7] X Research source If your AirPods do not show up here, you'll need the case to perform troubleshooting issues, like forgetting the connection and pairing again.

steps.title: Open the Action Center.
steps.content: Open the Action Center. It's the icon that looks like a chat bubble on the far right of your taskbar. [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Right-click the tile and select Go to Settings.
steps.content: Right-click the tile and select Go to Settings . This will open a Bluetooth Settings window. [9] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click to select your AirPods.
steps.content: Click to select your AirPods. You should see them under "Audio" or "Other Devices" if you have previously paired them with your computer. [10] X Research source If your AirPods do not show up here, you'll need the case to perform troubleshooting issues, like forgetting the connection and pairing again. [11] X Research source
